title: GitHub Issues compatibility
description: Design and implement compatibility with GitHub Issues for export/import. See .decisions/002-github-issues-compatibility.md for analysis. Phase 1: add optional github_id and labels fields. Phase 2: one-way export via gh CLI. Future phases: import and bidirectional sync.

title: Audit issues skill against GitHub Issues semantics
description: Compare current issues skill schema and workflow against GitHub Issues. Identify gaps and alignment opportunities. Document field mappings, missing features, and naming differences. See .decisions/002-github-issues-compatibility.md Protocol Fitness section.

title: Evaluate exact field naming for protocol fitness
description: Would using exact GitHub Issues field names (vs close approximations) measurably help Claude Code? Consider: status vs state, labels vs tags, assignee vs owner. The benefit is probabilistic - closer matches should activate stronger priors. See decision 002 Q2.

title: Explore GitHub task list syntax integration
description: GitHub's task list syntax (- [ ] item) is extremely common in training data. Consider: (1) supporting task lists in issue descriptions, (2) rendering completion percentage, (3) auto-closing referenced issues when checked. Strong protocol fitness opportunity. See decision 002.

title: Evaluate branching workflow conventions
description: Should we recommend branch-per-issue workflow for complex issues? GitHub heavily involves PR→Issue links and commit references. Tentative convention: yolo on main for simple issues, branch for issues with children or blocking relationships. See decision 002 Q5.

title: Research existing local-first issue trackers and Claude Code skills
description: Survey existing 'GitHub Issues but local' tools: git-bug, Bugs Everywhere, ditz, git-issue, ticgit, Fossil. Evaluate: (1) file format and human-readability, (2) git integration approach, (3) sync capabilities, (4) patterns worth borrowing. Also search for existing Claude Code skills for issue tracking. Goal: confirm our simpler approach is right for AI-native use case, or identify improvements.

title: Finalize design doc process conventions
description: Review and accept/modify decision 003 (design doc process). Consider: (1) retroactively updating existing decisions, (2) whether we need Rejected status, (3) formal vs informal acceptance process. See .decisions/003-design-doc-process.md.

title: sessions.py: add --last N alias and --help flag
description: sessions.py has --recent N but not --last N. Using --last 2 silently falls through to default (single last session). Fix: (1) add --last as alias for --recent, (2) add --help flag showing usage. Currently unknown flags are silently ignored, which caused confusion at session start.

reason: Won't implement - decided in D3 of .decisions/002-github-issues-compatibility.md. Issue tracker semantics around task lists (tracking completion, percentages, auto-close) rejected to avoid two mechanisms for dependencies. blocked_by handles the use case. GFM checkbox syntax in markdown descriptions is separate - that's just rendering, not tracking.
